intro: Pimelea ciliata, commonly known as the silky pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in heathlands and coastal areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens, particularly in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
